Class BTBehavior

java.lang.Object
tage.ai.behaviortrees.BTBehavior
Direct Known Subclasses:
BTAction, BTComposite, BTCondition, BTDecorator
public abstract class BTBehavior extends Object
BTBehavior is an abstract base class that represents a node in a behavior tree. BTBehavior is the base class for other behavior tree nodes such as actions, conditions, sequences, and selectors.
Author:
Kenneth Barnett, Alex J. Champandard
See Also:

    Behavior Trees Starter Kit

  • Constructor Details

    • BTBehavior

      public BTBehavior()
      Constructs a BTBehavior. By default the return status is set to BH_INVALID and node type is set to GENERIC.

  • Method Details

    • tick

      public BTStatus tick(float elapsedTime)
      A helper/wrapper method. Tick makes sure that the sequence of BTBehavior methods are called correctly. The proper sequence is onInitialize() -- update() -- onTerminate() -- return status. Note that before onInitialize() and onTerminate() are called the return status is check to make sure that it is NOT currently equal to BH_RUNNING.
      Returns:
      The return BTStatus of the node.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the return status of the node to BH_INVALID.

    • abort

      public void abort()
      Aborts the nodes. Calls the onTerminate() method and sets the return BTStatus to BH_ABORTED.

    • isTerminated

      public boolean isTerminated()
      Returns:
      TRUE if the BTStatus of the Behavior is BH_SUCCESS or BH_FAILURE; FALSE otherwise.

    • isRunning

      public boolean isRunning()
      Returns:
      TRUE if the BTStatus of the Behavior is BH_RUNNING; FALSE otherwise.

    • getStatus

      public BTStatus getStatus()
      Returns:
      BTStatus of the Behavior node.

    • getType

      public BTNodeType getType()
      Returns:
      BTNodeType of the Behavior node.
